column1: #Text=The idea of actually using a watch--the old-fashioned pocket kind or the one many people still used strapped to their wrist (the very first models were called 'strap watches') is, in itself, archaic.
#Text=I almost forgot: as a fashion statement, it's right up there (so to speak) with earrings, I guess...I stopped wearing a watch years ago.
#Text=Sit in the car: digital read-out on the dash.
#Text=Use a computer: there's the time, lower right of the monitor screen.
#Text=Walk into the kitchen; Yup, time's right there on the microwave or stove.
#Text=Go any place public, chances are you'll see a clock of some sort.
#Text=And, there's always, ''scuse me, have you got the time?'
#Text=And, by George, chances are the other person does--in a manner of speaking.
#Text=So it's one more thing I don't have to buy, or spend more money on repairs or batteries.
